description: 1981 DeLorean DMC-12
Excellently preserved car, stored from new
879 actual miles
One of 9,200 examples made
Only two factory options – a no-cost manual transmission and a gray interior
MSRP of $25,000 when new
Fiberglass underbody
Brushed stainless steel body with gullwing doors and gray interior
Rear-mounted 2.85L V-6 designed and built by Peugeot-Renault-Volvo under special contract and dual exhausts
PRV five-speed manual transmission
Documentation includes original owner's manual, owner's manual cover, stainless steel car care kit, DeLorean Tech Owner's Guide and Parts Manual and miscellaneous parts

MotoeXotica Classic Cars is thrilled to present yet another copy of the car made famous by the movie trilogy, “Back to the Future,” a 1981 DeLorean DMC-12. This car has fewer than 900 miles on the clock, 603 of them accumulated over 28 years and has overall, this car has been excellently preserved, have been lovingly stored from new. With recent news that the DeLorean Motor Company in 2017 is going to reproduce a low-volume of DeLorean cars with a price rumored to be around the $100k mark, now is your chance to obtain the original DeLorean with only 879 original miles for much less than the up and coming reproduction!
Under the rear hood is a 2.85L V-6 engine designed and built by Peugeot-Renault-Volvo under a special contract with the DeLorean Motor Company.

Dressed in gleaming stainless steel, the car's body is in fantastic shape. The windshield and other glass panels are clear and crack-free. The car's lights are in similar condition. The car rolls on Cooper Cobra Radial GT tires, size 235/60R15 and factory wheel covers. All of the car's body panels are straight, the rear-mounted engine bay is tidy and the battery appears new.

The DMC-12's suspension is the four-wheel independent type with coil springs and telescopic shock absorbers. The front suspension used double wishbones, while the rear was a multi-link setup. In its original development stages, the car is said to have handled quite well. Design drawings clearly show that the design met NHTSA minimum bumper and headlight heights of the time.

Steering was rack and pinion, with an overall steering ratio of 14.9:1, giving 2.65 turns lock-to-lock and a 35-foot turning circle. DMC-12s were originally fitted with cast alloy wheels, measuring 14 by 6 inches wide on the front and 15 by 8 inches wide on the rear. Because the DeLorean is a rear engine vehicle, the DMC-12 has a 35%–65% front–rear weight distribution. The DMC-12 features power-assisted disc brakes on all wheels, with 10-inch rotors in front and 10.5-inch in the rear.

Inside, the gray seats are in excellent shape, as are the matching carpet, the headliner and dashboard. The factory three-spoke steering wheel, door panels, mirrors, center console and gear shifter. Completing the interior is a factory AM/FM stereo with cassette.

The DeLorean DMC-12 was a sports car manufactured by John DeLorean's DeLorean Motor Company for the American market from 1981-1983. The car features gull-wing doors and an innovative fiberglass body structure with a steel backbone chassis, along with external brushed stainless steel body panels. The gullwing doors, when opening, only require 11 inches clearance outside the line of the car, making opening and closing the doors in crowded spaces relatively easy.

The first prototype appeared in October 1976. Production officially began in 1981 in Dunmurry, a suburb of southwest Belfast, Northern Ireland, where the first DMC-12 rolled off the production line on January 21. Over the course of production, several features of the car were changed, such as the hood style, wheels and interior. About 9,000 DMC-12s were made before production halted in early 1983. In 2007, about 6,500 DeLorean Motor cars were believed still to exist.
Documentation includes original owner's manual, owner's manual cover, stainless steel car care kit, DeLorean Tech Owner's Guide and Parts Manual and miscellaneous parts.
This car is currently located at our facility in St. Louis, Missouri. Current mileage on the odometer shows 879 miles. It is sold as is, where is, on a clean and clear title. GET OUT AND DRIVE!!!
VIN: SCEDT26T0BD006940

For sale in our Nashville showroom is a 1981 Delorean DC-12. This Delorean for sale is a perfect example of the 1980"??s. In a decade where big hair and hair bands reigned supreme and the fashion palate was Bright and flashy a somewhat young auto executive decided he knew how to make a car better than anyone else. So he took his ideas of a futuristic stainless steel mid-engine car to Northern Ireland where for less than 3 years approximately 9000 of these ultra-rare cars were built. Now even for the "??80"??s this car was over the top! Every young urban professional or yuppy as they were called then lusted for one. The popularity was so great that the car was featured in the Michael J. Fox hit movie Back to the future "?¢ where the car had the ability to travel through time. Well this 1981 DC-12 for sale has all the right equipment but was ordered without the Flux Capacitor and the Mr. Fusion saving a lot of weight and who really wants to travel back in time? This incredible "??81 Delorean for sale has been in the same hands for over 30 years tucked in a garage and covered well taking care of and lightly used this special car has only 57800 miles logged on the odometer. This numbers matching 1981 Delorean for sale has the original 2.849 Liter V6 engine connected to the 5-speed manual gear box and it runs like the wind. When you lift the iconic gull wing door you will notice that this car has all the right options like A/C (that will need a recharge) and a cassette player for your dusty Def Leopard or Billy Joel tape as well as leather interior and power windows. So if you have always wanted one of these stainless steel beauties do not sleep on this one if possible it will be hard to find a better one just keep it below 88MPH! Options for this 1981 Delorean DC-12 include: A/C AM/FM cassette player Telescopic steering wheel Power windows and Leather interior. Now for sale in our Houston Showroom is this extremely cool & rare original DeLorean DMC-12! is a sports car manufactured by John DeLoreans DeLorean Motor Company for the American market from 1981"?83. The car features gull-wing doors and an innovative fiberglass body structure with a steel backbone chassis along with external brushed stainless-steel body panels. It became widely known and iconic for its appearance and it was modified to represent the concept of a time machine in the Back to the Future media franchise.  In 1995 a new separate company started reproducing new build cars to the open market.  This one is all original though.  The engine is a Peugeot-Renault-Volvo (PRV) 2.85 litre V6 which produced about 130 hp that was designed and built under special contract with the DMC Company. These PRV engines were a development of the 2.7 liter V6 in the Renault 30 and were built in the PRV Factory in Douvrin Northern France. The gearbox also designed by PRV was built at the Renault facility near Caen in Normandy.  The suspension of the DMC-12 is a four-wheel independent suspension coil springs and telescopic shock absorbers. The front suspension uses double wishbones while the rear is a multi-link setup. In its original development stages the car is said to have handled quite well.  The DMC-12 could achieve 0"?60 miles per hour (0"?97 km/h) in 8.8 seconds when equipped with a manual transmission. When equipped with an automatic transmission the DeLorean would accelerate from 0"?60 miles per hour (0"?97 km/h) in 10.5 seconds.  This one has only 17651 miles on it and is in fantastic condition.  It has the 3-speed automatic transmission.  Both the engine & transmission are healthy are run well.  The exterior panels are free from any major dents or scratches.  The leather interior is also in great shape with only a couple of cracks on the dash which was a common issue with these cars.   Features on this DeLorean include; AC (not blowing cold) AM/FM radio power brakes power windows tilt steering wheel seat belts leather interior & aluminum wheels.   The owner has rebuilt the entire fuel system back in 2010 a new alternator new starter AC belt & many other recent maintenance item receipts that will go with the car.   Don"??t miss your chance to own such a memorable and iconic car that will appreciate as you own it.  Give us a call now to make a deal! For more information on this 1981 Delorean DMC-12 call the Houston Showroom at 832-243-6220 or email
[Email Dealer]
Modified Classic 1981 DeLorean DMC-12 with Gold Accents

This fully restored, second owner DeLorean exudes wealth, performance, and style with 350 individual gold plated insignia and components.  A modified and upgraded 2.85L (174 cu-in) Phase 2 engine, 5 speed transmission, racing suspension and ground effects body package deliver acceleration, handling, and high speed stability to match its stunning exotic looks.  The upgraded interior includes two-tone, gray and white leather with matching sheep's wool seats, Kenwood CD/DVD sound system, and automatic remote control doors.  This car's iconic brushed stainless steel finish has been made even more distinctive with real gold accents throughout the interior, exterior, and engine bay.  A total of 14 oz of real 24k gold ($18,000 value at current prices) have been double-layer plated on carefully selected components. Gold accents, champagne colored bumpers/ louvers, and blue powder coated engine parts blend smoothly and consistently throughout.  At night, programmable and switchable blue LED's inside and out can give off a cool iridescence when you want to be noticed.

This car is a finished project that is in excellent mechanical condition, driven regularly, and needs nothing.  It was purchased from the first owner in 1986 in perfect condition with 13,965 original miles.   All restoration, upgrade and modification work was performed by Dan Botkin, DeLorean Motor Company, Huntington Beach, CA.   The interior is personally autographed by Back to the Future movie legends: Bob Gale (Director), Christopher Lloyd (Doc), Claudia Wells (Jennifer Parker), and Lea Thompson (Lorrain Baines).
Standard and Factory Option DMC-12 Features:

Brushed stainless steel body, Gull Wing doors, 2.85L V6 Engine, RWD, 5-Speed manual transmission, Functional A/C,  Original wheels  (gold plated) , Disc brakes,   Power windows, Gold mirrored tint in the fixed windows and rear quarters glass, Tilt and Telescope steering wheel, Electric side mirrors, Rear window defogger,  Dual cooling fans, cruise control.
Gold Plated Insignia and Components

:   This distinctive DeLorean exudes wealth, opulence, and style with gold accents that have been tastefully chosen and consistently applied on 350 individual pieces throughout.  A total of 14oz of real 24k gold (worth approximately $18,000 at today's gold prices) were used in the plating process resulting in a depth, luster, and sheen that can only obtained from real gold.  All components were double gold plated – durable enough to maintain a “like-new” appearance for decades of cleaning and polishing cycles.
Gold exterior parts: All exterior DeLorean insignia (front, rear, and sides), rims/wheels, exhaust tips, rear license accent plates, and headlight frames.
Gold engine and engine bay parts:  Louver stiffener, engine cover grille (top and bottom), alternator, ram air pipe, intake horn, exhaust pipes, oil pan, and radiator cap.
Gold interior parts:   Shift knob, shift gate, door latch pull rings, and window frames.
Gold tinted glass: Fixed side windows and rear quarters glass is mirrored gold tint.
Champagne paint:
The original silver colored bumpers, rear louvers, air dam, side underbody panels, and fascia have been re-painted in a champagne color to complement the stainless steel body and gold accents.
Blue Powder Coated Components
:  Door sill DMC background, Engine cover bottom panel and frame, valve covers, intake, radiator surge tank, selected brackets and tubing, and steering wheel accents.
Engine Modifications

:  Complete engine rebuild and inspection at 42,000 miles - block hot tanked, cranks, pistons, cylinders were all  dimension mic'd and clearance checked, new timing chain and water pump. Full Stage 2 Engine upgrade including Ram Air intake, shaved heads for 10:1 compression, full race camshaft, headers with 3 inch exhaust, engine harness upgrade. Tuned from intake through exhaust, this motor makes an estimated 300 plus hp. Upgraded alternator with near 2x power output to power the stereo and other accessories.
Upgraded Suspension:
Full racing suspension –springs and shocks, new steering stabilizers
Full Ground Effects Package

: Front air dam and side underbody panels improve aerodynamics and improve high speed stability, necessary when exploring the enhanced 155mph+ top end capabilities of the modified and upgraded engine.  They also further enhance the low-slung, supercar look of the DeLorean.
Upgraded Interior

:  New custom two-tone, grey and white leather upholstery, matching sheep's wool seats, thick padding, and carpet. Customized dash with console front speaker extension and rear padded opening storage enclosure.  Custom steering wheel, gold plated shifter knob.  Laser detector.
Automatic Doors
: Driver and passenger doors release and open via remote control
Upgraded Sound System
: Kenwood surround sound system, CD/DVD player with central console display. Amped with 9 speakers and subwoofer. Mp-3/I-phone connection for sound system. Back-up camera also feeds to display.
Blue programmable LED Lighting
:  LED lighting in the interior, underbody, wheel wells, engine bay, and side panel, rear intakes.  On-Off switches with some programmable.
Complete Documentation
:  Includes Owner's Manual, all maintenance records, and documentation regarding upgrades and modifications
Car History/Owners Notes:

I've owned this DeLorean for over 30 years and am its second owner.  It was purchased from the first owner in 1986 in perfect condition with 13,965 original miles, complete with all maintenance records and Owner's Manual.  It had a minor fender bender at 16,500 that was repaired better than new, and stayed in great condition as a California car until mid 2006 when I decided to upgrade it.  As a go-fast guy, I diligently researched the available modifications to engine, suspension, and body in order to unlock the full performance potential hidden in the stock DeLorean platform.   I wanted to improve the comfort of my DeLorean to make it more useful for daily drives, even more fun on date night, or for long trips.  Finally, I wanted my DMC-12 to be unique and distinctive – real gold insignia and component accents to add an even more upscale, opulent look to the OEM brushed stainless steel finish.  Blue powder coated engine components were chosen as a racing hint regarding the upgraded performance.  Huntingdon Beach DeLorean Dealership was selected to perform the modifications based on their capabilities and track record of successful DMC-12 restoration and modification projects.    The result is what you see here is the culmination of a dream…my Ultimate DeLorean.

Since being upgraded, this car has been driven on several long distance DeLorean group tours and other trips. On account of the craftsmanship and quality of the modifications, it is good looking, fast, reliable – a true joy to own and drive.  Unlike a lot of other sports cars, the DeLorean has storage space for  2 suit bags and 2 small carry cases in the front trunk, along with 2 sets of golf clubs behind the rear seats.  This car has the looks and polish to win a car show, while at the same offering time the practicality, reliability, and durability to drive it daily, take long weekend tours with someone special, or to wring out the motor real hard on a twisty fun road.  Complete documentation comes with the car.  With less than 8,000 miles since the restoration/engine rebuild and only 49,981 original miles (and counting) there is a lot of life left for a new owner to enjoy.
Serious Inquiries from Buyers Only, No solicitations. Cash or Certified Bank Check

John Z Delorean's superb track record as a General Motors Executive was beyond dispute, and it was in large part this reason which convinced the British Government to make huge investment in the plans for the DeLorean Motor Company's Belfast factory, to build a spectacular new sports car. Contrary to popular opinion he very nearly succeeded; the factory got built, all in the remarkably short period of three years. The innovative stainless steel body and hulling doors were well integrated into a strikingly attractive design by legendary Italian stylist Giorgetto Giugiaro; even today a DMC-12 will stop traffic like few other cars. However, cash flow issues, and a bleak economical climate, sales eventually overwhelmed the company, and forced them into receivership in 1982.This lovely example on offer is fitted with a rare manual gearbox and shows just 13,000Kilometers on the odometer. In good condition throughout this low mileage example is offered with EU tax documentation. This must be one of the best DMC-12s on the market today. View 1982 Delorean DMC-12 on 'http://www.coys.co.uk/cars/1982-delorean-dmc-12' for further details.
